009
010package imagingbook.common.threshold.global;
011
012import imagingbook.common.histogram.Util;
013
014/**
015 * <p>
016 * This is an implementation of the global "quantile" thresholder, described in
017 * Sec. 9.1 (Alg. 9.1) of [1].
018 * Requires the quantile (b) to be specified at instantiation.
019 * Method {@link #getThreshold(int[])} returns a threshold that will put AT LEAST the
020 * b-fraction of pixels (but not all pixels) in the background.
021 * </p>
022 * <p>
023 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic Approach</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
024 * </p>
025 * 
026 * @author WB
027 * @version 2022/08/22
028 */
029public class QuantileThresholder implements GlobalThresholder {
030        
031        private final double b; // quantile of expected background pixels
032        
033        public QuantileThresholder(double b) {
034                if (b <= 0 || b >= 1) {
035                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("quantile b must be in [0,1]");
036                }
037                this.b = b;
038        }
039
040        @Override
041        public int getThreshold(int[] h) {
042                int K = h.length;
043                int N = Util.count(h);  // total number of pixels       
044                double n = N * b;               // number of pixels in quantile
045                
046                int i = 0;
047                int c = h[0];
048                while (i < K && c < n) {
049                        i++;
050                        c = c + h[i];
051                }
052                
053                int q = (c < N) ? i : -1; // check if all pixels are included by the estimated threshold
054                return q;
055        }
056}
